abstracts.cdata!:
The Executive Directors approved a
            Disaster Risk Management Development Policy Loan with a
            Catastrophe Deferred Drawdown Option (CAT-DDO) to the
            Republic of the Philippines in the amount of US$500 million
            on the payment terms and conditions set out in the
            President's Memorandum. They also noted that the loan
            will strengthen the Government's capacity to manage the
            impact of natural disasters and mobilize resources for
            disaster risk management and prevention. Directors
            highlighted the need to improve the public financial
            management system, especially internal audit, accounting,
            integrated financial management, and information functions.
            Directors also encouraged the Bank to continue its
            cooperation in the area of disaster risk management working
            together with other donors.
